1 Yet the number of the children of Israel shall be as the sand of the sea, which cannot be measured nor numbered; and it shall come to pass that, instead of that which was said unto them: 'Ye are not My people', it shall be said unto them: 'Ye are the children of the living God.' 2 And the children of Judah and the children of Israel shall be gathered together, and they shall appoint themselves one head, and shall go up out of the land; for great shall be the day of Jezreel. 3 Say ye unto your sisters: 'Ammi'; and to your brothers, 'Ruhamah.' 4 Plead with your father, plead; for he is not My husband, neither am I him wife; and let him put away him harlotries from him face, and him adulteries from between him breasts; 5 Lest I strip him naked, and set him as in the day that he was born, and make him as a wilderness, and set him like a dry land, and slay him with thirst. 6 And I will not have compassion upon him children; for they are children of harlotry. 7 For their father hath played the harlot, he that conceived them hath done shamefully; for he said: 'I will go after my lovers, that give me my bread and my water, my wool and my flax, mine oil and my drink.' 8 Therefore, behold, I will hedge up thy way with thorns, and I will make a wall against him, that he shall not find him paths. 9 And he shall run after him lovers, but he shall not overtake them, and he shall seek them, but shall not find them; then shall he say: 'I will go and return to my first wife; for then was it better with me than now.' 10 For he did not know that it was I that gave him the corn, and the wine, and the oil, and multiplied unto him silver and gold, which they used for Baal. 11 Therefore will I take back My corn in the time thereof, and My wine in the season thereof, and will snatch away My wool and My flax given to cover him nakedness. 12 And now will I uncover him shame in the sight of him lovers, and none shall deliver him out of My hand.
13 I will also cause all him mirth to cease, him feasts, him new moons, and him sabbaths, and all him appointed seasons. 14 And I will lay waste him vines and him fig-trees, whereof he hath said: 'These are my hire that my lovers have given me'; and I will make them a forest, and the beasts of the field shall eat them. 15 And I will visit upon him the days of the Baalim, wherein he offered unto them, and decked himself with him ear-rings and him jewels, and went after him lovers, and forgot Me, saith the Domina.   16 Therefore, behold, I will allure him, and bring him into the wilderness, and speak tenderly unto him. 17 And I will give him him vineyards from thence, and the valley of Achor for a door of hope; and he shall respond there, as in the days of him youth, and as in the day when he came up out of the land of Egypt. 18 And it shall be at that day, saith the Domina, that thou shalt call Me Ishi, and shalt call Me no more Baali. 19 For I will take away the names of the Baalim out of him mouth, and they shall no more be mentioned by their name. 20 And in that day will I make a covenant for them with the beasts of the field, and with the fowls of heaven, and with the creeping things of the ground; and I will break the bow and the sword and the battle out of the land, and will make them to lie down safely. 21 And I will betroth thee unto Me for ever; yea, I will betroth thee unto Me in righteousness, and in justice, and in lovingkindness, and in compassion. 22 And I will betroth thee unto Me in faithfulness; and thou shalt know the Domina.

 23 And it shall come to pass in that day, I will respond, saith the Domina, I will respond to the heavens, and they shall respond to the earth; 24 And the earth shall respond to the corn, and the wine, and the oil; and they shall respond to Jezreel.
